comment.narrative: INDH 2008/09 elaborado con 7,000 ejemplares impresos. Encuesta Nacional de Percepción sobre Juventud elaborada y con 7,000 ejemplares impresos. 7,000 copias de CD interactivos del INDH con herramientas audiovisuales INDH 2008/09. Borradores preliminares de 4 estudios socioeconómicos y 4 cuadernos de Desarrollo Humano. Dos cursos virtuales sobre Desarrollo Humano impartidos con la Escuela Virtual. Cursos de Maestría en curso.

Nota Conceptual del INDH 2016 elaborada. Conformación del Consejo Asesor del INDH Apoyo técnico en la elaboración del Informe ODM 2015. Apoyo técnico en la creación del Indice de Pobreza Multidimensional del país. Movilizados recursos para el INDH 2016. Socialización de la Agenda 2030 para el Desarrollo

Al 30 de septiembre se cuenta con una Nota Conceptual del INDH 2016 sobre Migración elaborada y una lista de personas que podrían conformar tanto el Consejo Asesor como el Consejo Técnico del Informe que ya fue discutida con la Representación. Se han elaborado dos propuestas de movilización de recursos para el Informe pero no se cuenta aún con un donante principal. Tanto UNAH como UNITEC han ofrecido apoyo en especie para insumos de capítulos del Informe. Se elaboró un nuevo Prodoc del INDH que ya pasó por un Pre-PAC y un LPAC. Se ha estado brindando apoyo técnico al gobierno en el proceso de creación del IPM, que ya tiene una definición preliminar de dimensiones basados en los indicadores nacionales existentes derivados de la Encuesta Permanente de Hogares 2014. Una de las limitantes es que la dimensión de salud no está reflejada por no formar parte de la Encuesta. El Informe ODM/ODS 2015 ya fue elaborado bajo el liderazgo del gobierno a través de la Secretaría de Coordinación General y contó con apoyo técnico PNUD.

comment.narrative: 600.000 nuevos votantes excluidos del Censo Alto % de votantes inhabilitados aun incluidos en el Censo Electoral. Sistema informático en uso deficiente. Personal no capacitado sobre nuevo sistema informático. No existen acuerdos interinstucionales N° de ciudadanos sin documento de identidad. Ciudadanía y Medios de comunicación con bajos conocimientos sobre el proceso electoral. No existen mecanismos de monitoreo y de información pública sobre el cumplimiento de la ley electoral en relación a la participación de la mujer.

Asistir al Tribunal Supremo Electoral como institución promotora de la democracia representativa que en Honduras se expresa a través de elecciones primarias y generales y que tienen como marco superior la construcción y el ejercicio de la ciudadanía. • Nueva propuesta de reforma electoral presentada al congreso. • Nuevas directivas del TSE han recibido capacitación. • Censo ligado y actualizado simultáneamente con actualizaciones del RNP. • Unidades seleccionadas operando en convenios con PP e instituciones.

• Con la finalidad de evitar interrupciones en la implementación de la asistencia técnica electoral al TSE, es importante contar con mejores herramientas de planificación, especialmente con miras a los procesos de contratación del personal del proyecto y consultores. Adicionalmente, es recomendable firmar un acuerdo con el TSE en el cual se refleje una calendarización de las actividades del proyecto a llevar a cabo en el corto y mediano plazo con el fin de sortear retrasos generados en la aprobación de las actividades del proyecto por parte del Pleno de Magistrados.

a) Número de políticas, normativas e instrumentos para la gestión ambientalmente racional de productos químicos y residuos peligrosos elaboradas y adoptadas por el país. b) Toneladas existentes de plaguicidas contaminantes orgánicos persistentes que requieren exportación y eliminación final. c) Toneladas existentes de equipos contaminados con bifenilos policlorados que requieren exportación y eliminación final. d) Número de sitios contaminados con contaminantes orgánicos persistentes que requieren remediación. e) Cantidad de emisiones de contaminantes orgánicos persistentes producidos involuntariamente por la quema de residuos sólidos.

comment.narrative: a) 0 b) 18 toneladas inventariadas c) 196 toneladas identificadas en equipos en uso y desuso d) 18 estimados e) 400 gramos por año en equivalentes de toxicidad de dioxinas y furanos
a) 4 b) 60 toneladas exportadas y eliminadas del país c) 112 toneladas exportadas y eliminadas del país d) 18 e) 320 gramos por año en equivalentes de toxicidad de dioxinas y furanos

a) Aprobado y puesto en práctica el Reglamento para el Registro de Emisiones y Transferencia de Contaminantes (RETC) b y c) 60 toneladas de plaguicidas contaminantes orgánicos persistentes y 112 toneladas de Bifenilos Policlorados exportadas y eliminados del país cumpliendo la normativa internacional vigente. Se ha logrado superar la meta inicial del proyecto. e) 5 Planes municipales de gestión integral de residuos sólidos elaborados y puestos en operación incluyendo intercambios de experiencias en municipios seleccionados (Comayagua, Siguatepeque, Potrerillos, Distrito Central y la Mancomunidad de Municipios de Lempira (COLOSUCA)). En los municipios apoyados por el proyecto, se ha logrado evitar la quema de 95,552 toneladas métricas de residuos sólidos que representa que 89 gramos de equivalentes de toxicidad de dioxinas y furanos no se hayan liberado al ambiente.

description.narrative: Reduction in health and environmental risks of POPs through the application of principles of sound environmental management within the context of the National Implementation Plan for the Stockholm Convention
Degree of incorporation by key institutions of National Policy on sound management of hazardous chemicals and wastes, including POPs, in their activities.

comment.narrative: Key institutions do not have an effective coordination mechanism and the current one is not officially formalized. There is not an approved National Policy on chemicals to provide specific goals on Chemicals Management in Honduras, everyone works separately.
Actions related to sound chemical management included in operational plans of target institutions (SAG, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Labour, Ministry of Environment and Nartural Resources (SERNA)

The first General Assembly of the National Commission for Sound Management of Chemicals took place in February 2015. The Commission´s Board was set up, is led by the private sector, academy as Vice President and CESCCO as Secretary Executive. Standing committees were established in the areas of Pollutants Release and Transfer Registration, Chemical Emergency, Industrial Products, Pesticides, Monitoring and Evaluation among others. The Second Assembly of 2015 will be held in the month of November with the purpose of rendering implementation report of the Annual Work Plan and 2016 plan.

description.narrative: Quantity of POPs and pesticides contaminated with POPs in existence

comment.narrative: 18t (3.6t POPs pesticides and 14.4t of contaminated pesticides) are currently inventoried
No POPs pesticides or pesticides contaminated with POPs (0t) are reported.
0 tonnes of pesticides originally established in the Stockholm Convention are reported to date in Honduras.

description.narrative: Total mass of PCBs contaminated equipment (unused electrical transformers and capacitors contaminated with PCBs), that have been replaced and safely disposed of

comment.narrative:
First inventory found 58t of disused equipment with PCBs and 138t still in use.
Currently an estimated of 45t of equipment with PCBs are kept by the National Electric Power Company (ENEE), of which 42t (13t identified in first inventory without label information and 29t currently found) are disused and 3t are still in use.
Additional amount still in use, remaining to be quantified by ENEE under WB project (PROMEF).

100% (58t) of disused equipment found in first inventory and (42t) of disused equipment currently found held by the National Electric Power Company (ENEE) are eliminated having a grand total of 100t to be disposed.
The transformers currently in use will continue to be used with supervision, subject to eventual elimination after project end, additional amount of still in use transformers destroyed with World Bank (WB) funds.

A total of 112 tons of PCBs were exported to Spain in two exports registered in the month of May 2015. The case of electrical equipment will be decontaminated in Spain and oils incinerated in France. Currently as of June containers are in transit countries as recorded by the mobilization document of the Basel Convention. The certificate of final disposal will be available in August 2015.

description.narrative: Number of contaminated sites subject to remediation measures

comment.narrative: 5 contaminated sites with PCBs and 18 sites are considered as potentially contaminated with PCBs (1st Inventory); an additional site was found to date.
Remediation measures adopted in 6 pilot sites contaminated with PCBs and 6 pilot sites contaminated with POPs pesticides (5 storehouses and a containment area of a fruit company)

The project focused its actions to implement immediate measures to prevent and reduce risk, such as sealing three Storehouses and socializing the Management Plan of contaminated facilities with local authorities for the following sites:
Healh store house: Alto Verde,
Former health warehouse: Santa Maria del Real
School: José Cecilio del Valle
With respect to the assessment done to 9 potentially contaminated sites with PCBs CESCCO jointly with project and ENEE presented the results of the assessment in each of these sites during the month July of 2015. These sites are considered as NON CONTAMINANTED with PCBs, action plans were given to ENEE to prevent future contamination of PCB and HC. Potentially exposed population (61 staff members of ENEE) was also sensitized about the risks of PCBs on health and environment.

description.narrative: Reduction in the emission of unintentionally produced POPs from the burning of solid waste and landfill fires

comment.narrative: The first inventory of dioxins and furans reported 400 g I-TEQ/year, only for the sub category of solid waste burning and fires in municipal dumps. Baseline figure to be confirmed

80 g I-TEQ/year reduction in UPOPs emitted from burning of solid waste and landfill fires (20% reduction over currently estimated baseline level). This target will be reassessed at the outset of the project implementation.

In the reporting period have been properly handled a total of 95552 tons of solid waste that were previously burned resulting in 89 g / TEQ are avoided to the environment. This represents a reduction of 22.4% in the reporting period.
In the city of Siguatepeque and the Association of 5 Municipalities “COLOSUCA” the project has given support in awareness raising and evaluation of the compliance of the Solid Waste Master Plans with the aim of promoting the BAT/BEP related to waste management.
These 6 municipalities are still pending of having international funding for the operation of regulated landfills (Spain has confirmed will support the construction of 3 landfills), meanwhile, the practice of open burning of waste has decreased with project support by developing training to municipal staff, optimization of waste collection service and awareness raising.

description.narrative: Existence of adequate Institutional capacities and regulatory and policy framework for the management and elimination of POPs and the reduction of their impacts
Percentage of budget requirements of lead authority (CESCCO) satisfied for analysis and regulatory roles

comment.narrative: CESCCO currently do not have self-sustaining financial resources or personnel resources to address the management of chemicals in Honduras.
100% of the budget requirements for CESCCO, for the exercise of its regulatory functions on chemicals, are satisfied.

The executive decree that created the National Commission for the Sound Management of Chemicals (Decree 035-2013) provided a framework for the Centre for the Study and Control of Pollutants (CESCCO) through the Secretariat of State for Energy, Environment, Natural Resources and Mines to request to Secretariat of Finance additional budget to CESCCO to strengthen the Department of Management of chemicals and the aforementioned commission. New parameters are offered by the CESCCO by direct action of the project: PCBs analyses in oil by two methods (chromatography and electrodes) as well as pesticide POPs chromatography) in priority environmental matrices.
The project promoted the development and adoption of the Regulations for the environmentally sound management of PCBs (Ministerial Agreement 1071-2014) also produced the Handbook of the Best Environmental Practices for the Management of PCB equipment, which was approved by the Ministry of Environment. This has promoted CESCCO in the offering of PCB analysis to the public, as there is a demand based on the recently strengthened regulatory framework .

description.narrative: Frequency of meetings of National Management Committee (without GEF financial support)

comment.narrative: Meetings only held with external project support, for design of NIP enabling project and SAICM implementation plan having no specific national budget lines to be sustainable.

Medium Term Work Plan elaborated and 4 meetings held per year.
Integration of sound management of chemicals in 4 key institutions.

In the month of February 2015 the first general assembly of the National Commission was developed, it is expected the second meeting in November 2015.
To date, the 10 standing committees have met, four (4) of them have been strengthened in this reporting period by the project (101 people in total have met):
The PRTR committee (20 people trained); chemical emergencies committee (26); monitoring and evaluation committee (15); and pesticides management committee (30) have received training on each of their topics.

description.narrative: Existence and implementation of appropriate regulatory instruments and guidelines regarding solid waste management and chemicals management

comment.narrative: Regulatory Framework has gaps that prevent inter-agency coordination and clear guidelines on how to conduct a comprehensive management approach based in life cycle of chemicals. Lack of specific regulations for site remediation and hazardous waste management, as well as technical and practical guidelines for municipalities on solid waste management.

Regulatory instruments generated on:
-Management of Solid Waste
-Implementation of PRTR, Management of Contaminated Sites
Technical Guides and standards on transport of Dangerous Goods, Storage of Industrial Chemicals, temporary storage of Hazardous Waste, environmental quality and remediation criteria for contaminated sites, sound management of PCBs and Solid Waste Management.

13 regulatory instruments have been generated which 8 have been socialized, 7 have been approved by the competent authorities, five have been published in the Official Gazette and are in compliance and 3 are under development. The instruments are: 1) A public Policy on chemicals (Decree PCM-029-2013) 2) National Commission of Chemicals (Decree 035-2013) 3) Regulation of equipment and wastes containing PCBs (Decree 1071-2013 ) and Manual for BEP for the Management of PCBs (Decree 1071-2013) and 5) Regulation of PRTR (Decree 1070-2014) 6) Functions Manual for the Department of Chemicals Management (approved) 7) Functions Manual for the Department of Solid Waste Management (approved) 8) Procedures Manual of the PRTR regulation (approved) 9) Regulation for the Management of Contaminated sites (developed, needs further socialization) 10) Procedures Manual for the Regulation for the Management of Contaminated Sites (made) 11) Technical Standard for Soil Quality (under development) 12) BAT / BEP Industrial Waste - Technical Guide (under technical review) and 13) Act of solid waste (under preparation).

description.narrative: Adequacy of procedures for monitoring effectiveness of management of POPs and other chemicals

comment.narrative: Currently does not operate a system of effective information exchange between possessors of POPs (and UPOPs releasers) and regulatory institutions. Conditions are unknown for hazardous waste and their holders.

Under the PRTR program, POP holders report their inventories and unintentional releases to the automated system. CESCCO maintains a database of holders of POPs and unintentional release of POPs sources .

POPs owners continue to report voluntarily to the CESCCO 2015 PRTR system. Recently PRTR regulation was published in the Official Gazette sectors subject to reporting and owners of POPs should report to PRTR in 2017 considering transfers and releases that occurred in 2016. In June 26 2015, the Secretary of Energy, Natural Resources, Environment and Mining published a notice of the obligation to report to the registration of PCBs and PRTR. In this report, transfers of POPs pesticides (60 tons) and PCBs (112 ton) that were exported for environmentally safe disposal abroad with project support will be reflected.

description.narrative: Percentage of laboratory analyses required to monitor the implementation of national policy on hazardous chemicals and wastes being carried on a cost recovery basis

comment.narrative: CESCCO currently is not sustainable, only 10% are being carried on a cost recovery basis
80% of laboratory analyses are being carried on a cost recovery basis (derived from the implementation of the National Policy).

The project facilitated the provision of strategic documents to achieve the increase in the percentage of total funds raised by the provision of CESCCO´s services.
Of what is perceived by the payment of laboratory services in CESCCO, 70% is returned to sustainability in this area.
New services such as PCB analysis by two methods (gas chromatography and electrode) and POPs pesticides by gas chromatography are now being offered by CESCCO.
The project succeeded in the development of important instruments to improve CESCCO laboratory services. For example it was generated a methodology for calculating the actual costs of laboratory services , including new parameters to be offered (PCB and pesticide POPs).
Also, a proposal for automated services provided by CESCCO was developed by the project. This improves the quality management system of the laboratory , streamlines processes and improves customer care .

description.narrative: Increased awareness regarding the nature, impacts and management of hazardous chemicals and wastes
Number of teachers in basic and intermediate education centers that have included the issue of chemicals management in their classes.

comment.narrative: Environment has been mainstreamed into the national educational curriculum, however there is no reference to the issue of teaching COPs, the chemical approach is contained only in pesticides.

350 Teachers of basic and middle level education of the priority regions (depending on the problem by chemicals at the national level) have approached the issue of Sound Management of Chemical in the Science class and other relevant subjects (environmental education).

The goal set by the project consisted of the design of educational material (Methodological Guide on chemicals management aimed at teachers) and training for 350 teachers from public educational institutions unofficial sector. This goal was surpassed for a total of more than 429 teachers in the area of Natural Sciences of primary and secondary education from nine departments. Additionally this educational material was officially approved by Ministerial Decree (Decree 24/04/13 and published in the Official Gazette March 12, 2014) for incorporation into teacher training materials. A delivery of 1,000 copies of the methodological guide for teachers of public schools with project support will be in the month of August 2015.

description.narrative: Number of postgraduate programmes that include aspects of risk management of hazardous chemicals in their pensum.

comment.narrative: No graduate program now considers the risk management for chemicals, there is only the risk management approach for natural phenomena.
At least a postgraduate programme incluiding chemical management in its curriculum.

description.narrative: Proportion of project beneficiaries in pilot sites who have increased awareness on the environmentally sound management of chemicals and pesticides with emphasis on the practice of not burning of wastes

comment.narrative: Awareness of chemical and waste issues is virtually inexistent (baseline to be defined precisely at project start)
170,000 people are awareness on the environmentally sound management of chemicals and pesticides with emphasis on the practice of not burning of wastes (criteria to be determined at project start)

The project developed an awareness campaign in three departments of Honduras (Comayagua, Cortés and Choluteca) directed a target audience of 170,000 people. The concept of the campaign was based on preventing the use of chemicals and not burning garbage reaching a goal of 1,445,000 people. This media campaign used local radio and national media, print media and knowledge fairs taking the issue of chemicals and not burn garbage.
Highway´s billboards were installed with the message "Do not burn trash" on the main roads of the country, where about 10 000 vehicles circulating daily.

description.narrative: Numbers of staff members of key institutions with knowledge of chemicals management issues such as lifecycle management of chemicals, occupational safety, first aid for poisoning, management of contaminated sites

comment.narrative: 30 staff members of key institutions have knowledge of the management of chemicals that were strengthened in the framework of the Stockholm Convention enabling project and QSP SAICM project.-
120 members nationwide with knowledge of the management of chemicals including members of key government institutions, private sector and NGOs.

description.narrative: Sound environmental management and elimination of intentionally produced POPs
Number of sites subjected to detailed inventories of PCB stocks.

comment.narrative:
Sites inventoried to date:
Private sector 48
ENEE 70
Other public facilities 1
Total 119

Additional sites to be inventoried:
Private sector 70
ENEE 20
Other public facilities 10
Total 100

The inventory of the public and private sector was completed, reporting a total of 211 tons of PCB containing equipment and wastes. Of the 211 tons, 112 tons of equipment and PCBs wastes were exported to Spain for environmentally safe disposal. 99 tonnes are still to be eliminated, which represent PCB equipment still in use.
It is expected though that the amount of PCB containing equipment might increase in the future, as decree 1070-2014, developed with support of the project, requires all equipment owners to report to CESCCO.
The National Electricity Company remains the principal owner of most PCB equipment, followed by the private sector and non ENEE institutions of the public sector.

description.narrative: Total mass of PCB equipment to which the private sector has made a commitment for replacement and disposal

comment.narrative: Current mass to be determined through inventories (5t found to date)
Commitments exist to eliminate 30t of PCBs equipment (subject to results of inventory)

With respect to private sector PCB owners, the mining company (Nyrstar) participated in the preparation of a plan for the management of PCB containing equipment (PCB equipment has now been inventoried) and implementation of a comprehensive plan to develop a more comprehensive inventory.
Technical assistance is being provided by the project’s staff and CESCCO to allow the private sector to gradually comply with the registration process established under the recently approvednational legislation.
NYSTAR is expected to submit its PCB management plan in August 2015 to the environment authority. The company will receive public recognition for its efforts.
One piece of electrical equipment with PCBs from the fruit company was reported in the inventory and was subsequently exported for disposal. PCB phase-out from the sugar company is still pending.

description.narrative: Number of storage sites containing or intended for POPs pesticides and PCBs in the country that have adequate conditions for safe temporary storage.

comment.narrative:
One store house with regular conditions for the containment of pesticides POPs, one vault of the private sector that contains 3.5 tons of DDT. Four store houses with inadequate containment conditions of contaminated pesticides with POPs.
15 sites with disused equipment containing PCBs.

1 sites for centralization of equipment contaminated with PCBs to be financed by ENEE and 1 site for POPs contaminated pesticides to be financed by Ministry of Health, with adequate storage conditions, containing chemicals currently stored in other sites (POPs pesticides and the ones contaminated with POPs held in 4 storehouses.

A storage facility for PCB containing electrical waste equipment has been constructed with funding provided by the World Bank. It has received the authorization of the Municipality of Tegucigalpa and an environmental permit from the Ministry of Energy, Natural Resources, Environment and Mining. The storage/collection center will provide storage for PCB equipment from the south central region of the country.
All of the POPs pesticides from El Guanabano (property of the Ministry of Health) were removed as well as all POPs pesticides from the storage facility of the Secretariat of Agriculture and Livestock (Nueva Aldea) were removed. Facilities were also decontaminated by the company contracted for the disposal of pesticides.

description.narrative: Number of members of staff of ENEE and private sector with knowledge of safe PCB management

comment.narrative: To be determined through staff surveys to be carried out at project start up
223 Employees of the ENEE have knowledge on the Environmentally Sound Management of waste and equipment containing PCBs

The project has trained 70 employees of ENEE, bringing the total number of people training in the management of PCB equipment to 200.
In August 2015, new training sessions will be developed to administrative and corporate communication staff (40 people).
The project expects to surpass its initial target to train 223 skilled employees.

description.narrative: Minimized releases of unintentionally produced POPs from current Waste Management practices.
Number of municipalities implementing Integral Management of Solid Waste.

comment.narrative: Currently all municipalities show weakness in the management of solid waste, open burning of wastes at the stage of final disposal prevails and there are limitations on the collection service, with backyard waste burning practices. Local governments do not have a comprehensive perspective on solid waste management.
5 municipal pilot projects developing Master Plans for integral management of solid wastes.

The project has continued to provide support for pilot municipalities (9 in total) to comply with the master plans for the integrated management of municipal solid waste that were formulated with project support.
It is noteworthy to report that due to the great empowerment that has resulted from the development of the master plans, the Secretary of Energy, Natural Resources and Environment issued a generic guide for developing solid waste master plans.
The Project has made efforts towards strengthening the technical committee members responsible for carrying out the actions of the master plans. The project has generated monitoring and evaluation instruments of solid waste master plans and trained local staff in its use (to date Comayagua and Tegucigalpa have been trained).

description.narrative: Reduction in the amount of solid wastes that are burnt

comment.narrative: Approximately 425.000 tons of domestic solid waste are burned.
The amount of solid waste burned is reduced by 20 %, which corresponds to 80 g TEQ or 85.000 t of solid waste not burned.

The capacity building has been fruitful in the sense that service coverage for waste collection in the pilot municipalities has been increased since training was provided, resulting in a higher volume of waste that is being disposed of at designed sites rather than burned in the open.
In this reporting period a total of 95,552 tons of solid waste has been properly handled that were previously burned: Comayagua (18,171.65 t); Tegucigalpa (68,145.14 t) and Potrerillos (9,205 t)
This resulted in a reduction of the releases of UPOPs estimated at 89.00 g - TEQ.

description.narrative: Number of municipal waste disposal sites with adequate management practices (non-burn)

comment.narrative: Usually in the country the burning of solid waste at the disposal stage is a voluntary practice, and occasionally happens accidentally.
5 municipal pilot projects implementing integral management of solid wastes including non-burning practices of wastes in domestic and landfill area.

9 pilot municipalities continue pursuing the aim of providing environmentally safe disposal options other than the burning of wastes.
To date nine (9) municipalities have had project support (Tegucigalpa, Comayagua and Potrerillos) which properly manage their landfills in compliance with the formulated master plans. Siguateque and the Association of 5 Municipalities (COLOSUCA) are pilot projects as well, despite they don’t have a regulated landfill, the project has supported in the development, implementation and monitoring of their Municipal Solid Waste Master Plans and capacity building of municipal staff to adopt BAT/BEP to decrease practice of burning of waste in open. The project has also supported these 9 municipalities in awareness raising through public campaigns (radio messages, billboards, educational fairs, among others).

1. Fortalecer las capacidades de las instancias municipales en materia de seguridad ciudadana, para viabilizar los PLCySC (Consejo Municipal y Comité de Seguridad); 2. Evaluar el avance de la implementación del componente en los barrios seleccionado para la aplicación de la metodología CPTED 3. Continuar con el fortalecimiento de capacidades en arte y cultura ciudadana a nivel de barrios vulnerables a la violencia en los municipios del proyecto, bajo la facilitación técnica de jóvenes líderes formados por el programa. 4. Fortalecer capacidades y generar oportunidades de acceso a financiación para jóvenes de escasos recursos que viven en barrios vulnerables a la violencia a fin de que puedan poner en marcha su propio emprendimiento y generar autoempleo. 5. Continuar con el fortalecimiento de capacidades en arte y cultura ciudadana a nivel de barrios vulnerables a la violencia en los municipios del proyecto, bajo la facilitación técnica de jóvenes líderes formados por el programa. 6. Publicar y socializar los resultados finales del diagnóstico de violencia contra las mujeres en las distintas municipalidades. 7. Seguimiento a la puesta en práctica de la guía metodológica para la incorporación del enfoque de género en planes locales de convivencia y seguridad ciudadana mediante talleres en cada municipio, uno de inducción y otro de seguimiento. 8. La implementación del sistema de información en las OMM incluye la instalación, configuración y funcionamiento correcto del sistema informático, así como el seguimiento. 9. Sensibilizar a la ciudadanía en general con temas relacionados con género, juventud y convivencia, a través de la implementación de una campaña de comunicaciones en los municipios de intervención. 10. Sistematizar la experiencia del Proyecto en los municipios de Distrito Central, San Pedro Sula, Choloma, Tela y La Ceiba mediante un proceso participativo donde intervengan las municipalidades y demás socios locales para generar aprendizaje que permita al

1. Formación de la Red de Actores Voluntarios en Convivencia Comunitaria para los cinco municipios (Choloma, Distrito Central, La Ceiba, Tela y San Pedro Sula). 2. Gestión para la apertura de los Puntos de Convivencia Comunitaria en el Distrito Central en las siguientes localidades: Colonia La Kennedy, Colonia Estados Unidos, Colonia Villa Nueva y Colegio Milla Selva. 3. Apertura de la Unidad de Mediación y Conciliación en la Alcaldía del Distrito Central. 4. Formulación de cuatro Planes Operativos Anuales correspondientes al año 2015 para las Municipalidades de San Pedro Sula, Choloma, Tela y La Ceiba. 5. Desarrollo del proceso de Rendición de Cuentas para los municipio de San Pedro Sula, Choloma, Tela y La Ceiba. 6. Formulación de la Guía para la Incorporación del enfoque de género en Planes Locales de Convivencia y Seguridad Ciudadana. 7. Fortalecimiento de infraestructura y capacidades técnicas de la Oficina Municipal de la Mujer en el Municipio de Tela. 8. Desarrollo de tres experiencias piloto poniendo a funcionar tres fondos de financiamiento para jóvenes emprendedores en La Ceiba, Tela y un Fondo de Crédito en Choloma. 9. Proceso de formación de "joven a joven" en donde se trabajaron los temas de cultura de paz, valores y principios, cultura ciudadana y prevención de violencia y de igual manera temas artísticos. 10. Formación a funcionarios municipales y del IDECOAS - FHIS en el Diplomado Prevención Situacional por medio del diseño ambiental. 11. Elaboración de los pre diagnósticos en al menos un barrio de intervención del proyecto.

comment.narrative: Se forma un grupo de Diálogo Democrático compuesto por 18 líderes de la Sociedad Civil y los partidos políticos, para elaborar propuestas para un acuerdo nacional amplio Se encuentra operando una Mesa de Diálogo entre Partidos integrada por 5 partidos políticos históricos USI-CVR es creada para dar seguimiento a las recomendaciones de la CVR No se practicaron ejercicios TREP durante las últimas elecciones El Equipo de Asistencia Técnica para TSE ha sido establecido y está operando

- 10 miembros del Grupo de Diálogo Democrático participan en las reuniones de trabajo para el análisis de país y para la elaboración de propuestas - 12 reuniones del Grupo de Diálogo Democrático se organizan para elaborar análisis y propuestas de trabajo - 2 reuniones con la Plataforma Institucional para la elaboración de propuestas y acuerdos - 2 reuniones con partidos políticos, sociedad civil y Tribunal Supremo Electoral (bilaterales y generales) para la generación de acuerdos en los temas relacionados con la reforma electoral - 2 jornadas de capacitación para diputadas del Congreso Nacional con el fin de fortalecer su participación en su labor parlamentaria - Una propuesta de fortalecimiento institucional del Grupo de Diálogo Ciudadanía Activa - 2 procesos de acompañamiento técnico al nuevo equipo de gobierno (Derechos Humanos y Transparencia) - Un estudio de análisis político-estratégico para la toma de decisiones

comment.narrative: No existen o no han sido implementadas las herramientas técnicas y legales para Gestión de Riesgos de la Secretaría Ejecutiva de SINAGER (COPECO) SINAGER no cuenta con adecuados mecanismos de coordinación Las plataformas y programas electorales de los candidatos políticos no incluyen Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres como parte de sus prioridades nacionales/locales No existen Herramientas sobre Gestión de Riesgos Sectoriales No existen Planes de Asistencia Técnica Sectoriales en apoyo a los gobiernos locales La página de la red del PNUD sirve como una plataforma de conocimiento sobe Gestión de Riesgo de Desastres para contrapartes nacionales e internacionales, incluyendo UNCT, recibiendo aproximadamente 2,500 visitas durante el año anterior

# Plan estrategico y plan operativo anual de la Subsecretaria de Prevencion # Productos de la estrategia de comunicaciones. # de cooperantes articulados por la Unidad de Cooperacion Externa. # Planes Municipales integrados a Municipios mas Seguros.

1) Developed a strong relationship with the Violence Prevention Sub-Secretariat. The UNDP Country Office has successfully established a good working relationship with the Violence Prevention Vice-Minister and staff. The SSR Project Coordinator has managed to build a relationship based on trust and mutual respect opening the doors to implement capacity building activities and strengthen the Violence Prevention Sub-Secretariat at different levels to implement violence prevention policies, programmes and activities.
2) Build capacity by placing at the Violence Prevention Sub-Secretariat a UNDP Consultant (SSR Coordinator), a UNV Violence Prevention Specialist and a Communications Specialist. The SSR Project Coordinator oversees overall project activities, serves as policy advisor and lends direct support to the Violence Prevention Vice-Minister. The UNV Violence Prevention Specialist works full-time at the Sub-Secretariat to assist senior and mid-level staff in day-to-day tasks and monitors implementation of SSR activities. The Project is also in the process of hiring a Communications Specialist for the July-December period to manage internal communications, such as bulletins and gather Project information, and produce communication materials for both internal and external audiences.
3) Signed a letter of agreement (LoA) between the UNDP and UNODC to implement the “Strengthening Families Program”. The aim of this agreement is to train trainers that can learn the Program's methodology and how to train community leaders and trigger a multiplier effect. The trainers will be deployed in two communities selected by the Prevention Sub-Secretariat while at the same time UNODC has agreed accompany the process all throughout.
4) Other activities include developing a citizen security plan that covers six municipalities that report the highest levels of crime and violence in the country. It is also working to improve access to basic services and creating income generation op

Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1. Conformación de una Panel Nacional de expertos y firma de carta acuerdo con la Comisión Permanente de Contingencias COPECO. 2. Documento técnico de criterios nacionales de sequía elaborado. 3. Metodología para el Monitoreo de la Sequía elaborada. 4. Documento marco estratégico de recuperación por sequía elaborado.

comment.narrative: No existe

Resultado 1. Proporcionar asistencia para la coordinación y seguimiento de la recuperación temprana, y criterios nacionales para la declaración de la sequía.
Resultado 2. Realizada la asistencia técnica para la identificación de las necesidades de recuperación temprana.
Resultado 3. Provista la asistencia técnica para la planificación de la recuperación temprana (Marco estratégico para la recuperación, un plan de acción

Carta Acuerdo con Comisionado Nacional de los Derechos Humanos CONADEH: El acuerdo estableció una alianza estratégica generando flujos de información constantes entre el Sistema de las Naciones Unidas (SNU) en Honduras y el CONADEH sobre las emergencias humanitarias interrelacionadas debidas a la sequía y a la situación de la niñez migrante no acompañada, dirigida a mejorar la coordinación en la respuesta del SNU a través de los clúster de Protección y de Recuperación Temprana y bajo la aplicación del enfoque basado en Derechos Humanos.
Resultado 1: Documento técnico para la declaración de emergencia por sequía: Las sesiones regulares del panel han ayudado para conformar y formular criterios base para el desarrollo de: el documento y herramienta para el monitoreo de la metodología, la vinculación interinstitucional, las acciones a seguir, las debilidades interinstitucional y el documento protocolario para la declaración por sequía.
Metodología para el Monitoreo de la Sequía: La metodología vincula los productos/aportes del panel de expertos, carta acuerdo y productos de Luis Guardiola (indirectamente). Actualmente la herramienta está a un 90% completada, el 10% restante son pequeñas institucionalización de tareas vinculando con actores clave del gobierno. La elaboración de este modelo toma en cuenta la lógica de la Gestión de riesgos, partiendo la una definición de vulnerabilidad por sequía de la zona de estudio.
Fortalecimiento del conocimiento en materia de Recursos hídricos relacionado con la sequía: El taller con FWNET (herramienta GeoWRSI u GeoClima) nos da productos de índices de NDVI, para obtener un panorama de la afectación por sequía a un área nacional, esto ayudará a los técnicos a mejorar el conocimiento de afectación por sequía. El programa geoespacial, permite determinar calcular diferentes índices de imágenes satelitales.

title.narrative: Proyecto Regional de Seguridad Ciudadana Honduras

description.narrative: El objetivo principal de este proyecto es fortalecer las capacidades de las instituciones nacionales y locales para implementar el Programa "Municipios Más Seguros" bajo la Secretaría de Seguridad, específicamente la Subsecretaría de Prevención.

title.narrative: PRODOC Proyecto Regional de Seguridad Ciudadana en el Triángulo Norte de Centroamérica
Proyecto Regional de Seguridad Ciudadana Honduras

description.narrative: Mejorar la seguridad ciudadana mediante el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales y nacionales para la implementacion de intervenciones basadas en evidencias que atiendan los factores de riesgo en materia de criminalidad y violencia.
Defence - policy, planning and administration

- Secretaría de Seguridad cuenta con capacidad para el desarrollo del Programa Municipios más Seguros a partir de una guía y manual de procedimientos para la gestión de planes locales de convivencia y seguridad ciudadana. - Gabinete de prevención se encuentra operando y cuenta con manual de funcionamiento y agenda de reuniones definida
- Policía Comunitaria en de 3 ciudades cuenta con mejores equipamientos de infraestructura y recursos humanos formados - El Observatorio de la Violencia mejora su capacidad de análisis - Un modelo de seguimiento a los operadores de justicia se ha establecido en 1 municipalidad
- Documento de sistematización de lecciones aprendidas en prevención de violencia en las municipalidades - Alcaldes y operadores de justicia conocen experiencias en el marco de cooperación sur - sur

comment.narrative:
- Política de Seguridad Ciudadana y programa “Municipios Más Seguros” - Observatorio de la Violencia - Planes Locales en 12 municipios
- Programa de Policía Comunitaria funcionando en la Policía Preventiva con apoyo de la Policía Japonesa y Brasilera - Observatorio de la Violencia
- Informes de Desarrollo Humano en Seguridad para Centroamérica y El Caribe.
Instalada en la Subsecretaría el equipo base para implementación del Programa Municipios más Seguros.
La Subsecretaría de Prevención contará con un equipo base que le permitirá inicia la implementación de las actividades.

description.narrative: Fortalecimiento de las capacidades institucionales de la Presidencia de la República, a través de la implementación del Sistema de Gestión para la Gobernabilidad (SIGOB)

El objetivo del proyecto es fortalecer las capacidades institucionales del Gabinete Presidencial a través de la implementación del Centro de Gestión del Presidente y de la Presidencia de la República, a través de la implementación de sistemas de trabajo.
Anti corruption

1. Procedimiento del Centro de Gestión del Presidente de la República implementado 2. % de eventos programados en el CG del PR realizados 3. Funcionarios de la PR utilizando Correspondencia Oficial 4. Disminución del uso de papel 5. Procedimiento del Centro de Gestión de la Primera Dama implementado 6. % de eventos programados en el CG de la Primera Dama realizados

comment.narrative:
CENTRO DE GESTION DEL PRESIDENTE - El Gabinete del Presidente no cuenta con un procedimiento que integra sistémicamente la Estrategia de Gobierno Se registran los eventos en una agenda electrónica sin clasificación TRANSDOC - La Presidencia de la República no cuenta con en la actualidad con un sistema automatizado de gestión de la Correspondencia
CENTRO DE GESTION DE LA PRIMERA DAMA - El Despacho de la Primera Dama, no cuenta actualmente con herramientas automáticas e integradas para la gestión del antes, durante y después de su Agenda cotidiana. - El Gabinete de la Primera dama no cuenta con un procedimiento que integra sistémicamente la Estrategia de Gobierno - Se registran los eventos en una agenda electrónica sin clasificación - La Presidencia de la República cuenta con una Dirección de Gestión por Resultados

Implementado el Centro de Gestión en el Gabinete del Presidente de la República, instalado el sistema y transferidos conocimientos a la institución. Procedimiento del CG del Presidente incorporado en la rutina del despacho (Registro de Solicitudes, Reuniones del Comité de Agenda, Minutas de reuniones y Seguimiento a compromisos) 80 % de los eventos realizados programados en el CG Implementado el módulo de Transparencia Documental en Presidencia de la Nación, instalado el sistema, transferidos conocimientos a la institución y Mesa de Entrada, Salida y otros ámbitos con el Sistema en plena operación 50% de funcionarios de la PR capacitados y operando el sistema TRANSDOC 20% de disminución de uso de papel Implementado el Centro de Gestión de la Primera Dama, instalado el sistema y transferidos conocimientos a la institución. Procedimiento del CG de la Primera Dama incorporado en la rutina del despacho (Registro de Solicitudes, Reuniones del Comité de Agenda, Minutas de reuniones y Seguimiento a compromisos) 80 % de los eventos realizados programados en el CG

description.narrative: Early Recovery Project of Drought in Dry Corridor of Honduras

Apoyo a la coordinación de la ayuda humanitaria en municipios afectados en el corredor seco bajo un enfoque de derechos humanos. Además una estrategia de recuperación temprana por la pérdida de los medios de vida de subsistencia de la población afectada.
